Jet Engine Blade Scan (JEBS)

Precision inspection of turbine‑blade geometry – fast, reliable, repeatable.

Download Full Report

What is JEBS?

JEBS (Jet Engine Blade Scan) is a visual‑plus‑digital inspection method used to verify the dimensional compliance of turbine blades before they are cleared for assembly.

  • High‑resolution photography (pixel‑accurate)
  • Caliper cross‑check for critical measurements
  • Automatic pass/fail flagging against certified tolerance ranges

Why it matters

Ensuring every blade meets the designed offsets prevents:

  • Unbalanced rotor dynamics → reduced vibration
  • Premature wear on the bearing train
  • Loss of thrust and fuel‑efficiency penalties

Result: Safer flight, lower life‑cycle cost.

Proof of Accuracy

Case Studies

A320‑200 Engine Overhaul

Using JEBS reduced inspection time by 35 % and identified a previously‑undetected tip‑wear issue that saved the airline $120 k in warranty claims.

Military Fighter Jet Service

A fleet of 48 fighter jets achieved a 98 % blade‑pass rate after adopting JEBS, extending service‑intervals by 12 months.
